meanings.definition: The philosophical position that everything that exists is physical
meanings.sent1: In his essay, he argued for the importance of physicalism in understanding the world around us.
meanings.sent2: Many scientists adhere to physicalism, believing that all aspects of reality can be explained through physical means.
meanings.sent3: The debate between physicalism and dualism can sometimes get quite heated among philosophers.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to physicalism was as solid as the ground beneath her feet.
meanings.sent5: The concept of physicalism is like a sturdy foundation upon which other theories are built.

meanings.definition: The belief that only physical matter exists and that mental processes are a result of physical interactions
meanings.sent1: Physicalism suggests that mental activities are simply manifestations of physical processes in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Some psychologists reject physicalism, arguing that the mind cannot be reduced to purely physical components.
meanings.sent3: The idea of physicalism can lead to some interesting discussions about the nature of consciousness.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of physicalism was like a light bulb turning on in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The concept of physicalism can illuminate the connection between mind and body.

meanings.definition: The theory that all phenomena can be explained by physical laws and properties
meanings.sent1: Physicalism asserts that even seemingly mysterious events can be understood through physical principles.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often rely on physicalism to guide their research into the natural world.
meanings.sent3: The idea of physicalism can sometimes make you see the world in a whole new light.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to physicalism was like a compass pointing him in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The concept of physicalism can be a powerful tool for unraveling the mysteries of the universe.
